Get predefined @param label

Source: R/pkgsnip.gen.R
param_label.Rd

Returns a pre-defined label intended to be used to document a function parameter using roxygen2's @param tag.

Usage

param_label(name = roxy_labels(type = "param")$name, ...)

param_lbl(name = roxy_labels(type = "param")$name, ...)

Arguments

name

The label name. See roxy_labels() for possible values.

...

Further named arguments used to tailor the label to your needs. Not all labels require additional arguments, see roxy_labels() for an overview. If a required argument is not explicitly provided, it is searched for in the parent frames.

Value

A character vector.

Details

A label can be inserted using inline R code as follows:

#' @param PARAM_NAME `r pkgsnip::param_label("LABEL_NAME")`

Note that the above only works in roxygen2 7.1.0+.

Currently, the following parameter labels are available:

namearguments
data
data_colspal::prose_ls(cols, wrap = '')`
date
dates
datetime
datetimes
gt_obj
path
paths
plotly_obj
r_obj
response
strict_list
symbol
tabular_data
version_nr
opt_global_max_cache_agepkg, global_max_cache_age
cli_markup_support
dyn_dots_support
tidy_select_support
eol
quiet
start_date
end_date
use_cache
max_cache_age

See also

roxygen2 label functions description_label(), return_label(), roxy_labels(), roxy_label(), title_label()
